What we did Working principles

Hypotheses #3

We believe we should create a community of risk peers where they can connect and support each other

We'll see people communicating and sharing guidance and tips, and feeling they are part of something

We’ll know this is true when we seen people volunteering or joining the group, people asking questions and answering each other, we receive positive feedback from co-ordinators both ad hoc comments and as part of a quarterly survey

Related hypotheses

#4

Considerations

  • Keep it simple and see if tools are available to do it, we don’t need to buy anything (Slack works well in Digital)
  • BPs should be visible in there for assurance, support and to see how users and finding things
  • Experiment with structure, is it face to face, lunch etc?
  • Is it somewhere that could be run as a community of practice, for example getting feedback on stuff, or occasional f2f group discussions? Workshops?
  • Needs to be a safe space, we should encourage honesty and avoid a ‘blame’ culture
  • Use something like the retro prime directive:

    "Regardless of what we discover, we understand and truly believe that everyone did the best job they could, given what they knew at the time, their skills and abilities, the resources available, and the situation at hand."
